acknowledgments.summary: rgod working with Trend Micro’s Zero Day Initiative, Constantin-Cosmin CRACIUN, and Schneider Electric identified these vulnerabilities.

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: A successful exploit of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands or compromise the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Commercial Facilities, Critical Manufacturing, and Energy
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: COUNTRIES/AREAS DEPLOYED: United States, Europe, and Asia
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: COMPANY HEADQUARTERS LOCATION: France
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-17-180-02 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: Unauthenticated users can use calls to various paths in order to perform arbitrary SQL statements against the underlying database.CVE-2017-7973 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Schneider Electric’s security notice SEVD-2017-178-01 is available at the following location:
http://www.schneider-electric.com/en/download/document/SEVD-2017-178-01/
Firmware update Version 1.3.4, which includes fixes for most of these vulnerabilities, has been released. It is highly recommended that U.motion Builder users apply the patch in a timely manner.
The firmware is available for download at:
https://www.schneider-electric.com/en/download/document/SE_UMOTION_BUILDER/
U.motion server firmware update Version 1.3.4 is available for download at:
https://www.schneider-electric.com/en/download/document/Umotion_Server_update/

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: The vulnerability exists within processing of track_import_export.php. The underlying SQLite database query is subject to SQL injection on the object_id input parameter.CVE-2018-7765 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: The vulnerability exists within processing of applets that are exposed on the web service. The underlying SQLite database query to determine whether a user is logged in is subject to SQL injection on the loginSeed parameter, which can be embedded in the HTTP cookie of the request.CVE-2018-7772 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: The vulnerability exists within processing of sendmail.php. The applet allows callers to select arbitrary files to send to an arbitrary email address.CVE-2018-7770 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: The vulnerability exists within processing of editscript.php. A directory traversal vulnerability allows a caller with standard user privileges to write arbitrary php files anywhere in the web service directory tree.CVE-2018-7771 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

cwe.name: Improper Authentication

notes.text: The system includes a hard-coded valid session. If an attacker uses that session ID as part of the HTTP cookie of a web request, then authentication is bypassed.CVE-2017-9956 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

cwe.name: Use of Hard-coded Password

notes.text: The system comes with a system web access account hard-coded.CVE-2017-9957 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

cwe.name: Improper Access Control

notes.text: Improper handling of the system configuration can allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code under the context of root.CVE-2017-9958 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

Exception information is returned to the attacker that contains sensitive path information.CVE-2018-7776 has been assigned to this vulnerability. cwe.name: Improper Input Validation

notes.text: The vulnerability is due to insufficient handling of update_file request parameter on update_module.php. A remote, authenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the target server.CVE-2018-7777 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

cwe.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

notes.text: Samba since Version 3.5.0 and before 4.6.4, 4.5.10 and 4.4.14 is vulnerable to remote code execution vulnerability, allowing a malicious client to upload a shared library to a writable share, and then cause the server to load and execute it.CVE-2017-7494  has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 10.0 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
